What a wonderful experience staying here. Extremely clean, easy access, beautiful place. The history of the home is incredible and Julie has done a great job with a book describing the house's history and how it came to be as it is today. Bed's were comfortable and clean, rooms were nicely sized, beautiful historic character, and this house is close to EVERYTHING. Within a couple minutes to tons of restaurants, and right across the street from the Natural History Museum, and down the street from Piedmont Arts Center.
Would highly recommend this stay to anyone visiting the Martinsville area.

review_text: "Starling Place is probably the best Airbnb we've ever stayed at and here's why....The Martinsville location is excellent. It is centrally located and easily accessible. There is plenty of parking from the circular driveway in front to the two car driveway in the back with garage/back door access. The house itself is beautiful and welcoming! The access code worked perfectly. The house was so charming! (solid wood doors with glass handles, shining hardwood floors, broad staircase, gorgeous light fixtures) It had the timeless feel of a classic home with all of the comfortable, modern updates. The best part was the obvious concern for guests' comfort. The home was impeccably clean! The bathrooms had fluffy white towels galore AND a stack of beach style towels in the laundry room. The showers had dispensers for shampoo, conditioner and bodywash.

Julie was extremely responsive and accommodating to our situation while we worked out a new schedule and workers to come out. She graciously accepted our change of dates and change of guests which helped us keep our revised work schedule. The place was wonderful to stay in, conveniently located to the downtown area which is where we need to be. There was a random power outage on Wednesday morning, and Julie again was right on top of things for us as far as getting in touch with the power company and seeing how long the repair time would be. We were quite comfortable in the house and it had every amenity we needed. We can't thank Julie enough for a great stay and accommodating manner. We look forward to our next trip to Martinsville and will be hopefully staying here again. Thank you!

name: Barbara And CJ
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
March 2021
,
Â·
Stayed about a week
review_text:
Julie's house is in a great location in Martinsville. For families with dogs, there is a park within walking distance and the neighborhood is very dog friendly for casual walks. The view of the church and the stained glass windows across the street is gorgeous. The home is very comfortable. If you need to work while there, the desk in the office is a great plus. For us, the home was much larger than we needed for 2 people and our dog. But, for our travel needs, it was the perfect location, dog friendly and among the few in the area that take the extra care needed for cleaning during Covid. Sadly, we didn't have time in our schedule to enjoy the upstairs den and arcade game, or the lovely wrap around front porch. These features would make it the perfect place for a getaway with friends or a family gathering.
Besides being clean and safe during Covid, one of the most important things for us was a kitchen good for cooking big meals that we could deliver to nearby family members. The kitchen is an odd layout, but it worked very well for us. It's very well stocked and has good quality cooking pans. We personally have a focus on natural foods and healthy eating, and we don't use cookware that has chemical non stick coatings, etc. We have found that many nice Air BnB's have crappy cookware and the coatings are scratched, making them even more toxic. For long trips, we've started taking a few of our own kitchen items to make things easier. In advance, Julie assured me that her kitchen was well stocked for our needs and that we didn't need to bring our own. She did not disappoint!
Julie's communication before our stay and during was prompt and professional. When we had a family emergency and needed to extend our stay, she accommodated us. BUT, she wasn't willing to compromise the safety of the next guests and only allowed us to stay the amount of time that she would have time to air the house out for the proper time before the next arrival. That made it harder for us, but we really appreciated that she did the right thing---and she offered to help us find another place for the additional days we needed.
Highly recommend this stay!

review_text:
Anita & Denny offer welcome southern hospitality. we stayed 3 nights for a music festival and they never made us feel badly about coming g and going late in the evening.
We were treated to some awesome live music from the pair and learned a bit about their musical background. Everything went smoothly and the spaces both public and private were sparkling clean. I gave an overall 5 stars based on the room and amenities as expected from reading the space description. the room was quiet and secure. They provided a comfy bed with 2 pillow choices, additional box of snacks which in my opinion sets a host apart. A few dollars invested in the guest is so thoughtful when guests arrive and may be hungry without the opportunity to hit a market in a new area. Well done Anita.
Plenty of street parking.
Older bathroom/interior but as stated, sparkling clean and great water pressure in the shower of the ensuite bathroom off our room. They have multiple rooms available. The room included fridge, microwave and a basket of kitchen supplies truly making our stay a breeze.
We will definitely stay here again. Probably missed some things but easy communication so just ask Anita if you have questions before staying.

We were woken up by people mowing and weed whacking right outside our bedroom windows; they were carelessly mowing around our rental car, too, possibly kicking up damaging debris. It was extremely alarming to have unexpected people on the property, especially since weâ€™re not familiar with Martinsville. I messaged the host to see if they expected people to be on the property. Their response was, â€œThey are on a schedule and do it as available. We talked to them yesterday, they didnâ€™t give us a firm dateâ€¦Iâ€™m sorry, but itâ€™s the time of the year.â€ I understand that the lawn may need to be mowed while guests are occupying the property, but the host should have given us a heads up that random people may show up on the property during our stay.
Some details of the home also pose a threat to guestsâ€™ safety (e.g., electrical outlet in living room popped out of the wall), and the house could have been cleaner (e.g., bathroom walls were dirty).

She was not helpful and argued there was plenty of light from the pole. When I told her that was not accurate she argued stating all the keys worked fine and that she doesnâ€™t turn on the porch light. She said there was nothing she could do about it as she was 2 1/2 hours away. Then she said sheâ€™d see if she could get someone there to help me. It was about 32 degrees and a wind was blowing. I continued to try to unlock the locks. One key finally worked and I called to let her know. She told me I was rude.
The water pressure was so bad nor was it hot enough to take a shower.

I highly recommend this property and I look forward to interacting with the host in the future if I need to return to the area.

review_text: Cute house, recently remodeled, nicely decorated, and very clean. I arrived around 9:00 p.m. and felt a little uncomfortable with a few things right away. 1) very dark outside with no light except the front porch light; 2) grass next to the house was about a foot high; 3) no covering over the window at the kitchen door or the windows over the sink. Someone could have seen into the living room, kitchen, and partially down the hallway from the kitchen door window; 4) when I sat on the bed and then got up it creaked very loudly. I stayed a couple of hours and decided I would be more comfortable at a hotel. This was my first Airbnb experience, and, being a woman traveling alone, I may not have chosen the right kind of place (for me). However, the host was very accommodating and was going to consider a power pole outside and agreed to put blinds on the window of the kitchen door. Issue was reasonably resolved .

review_text: We had a full house of 10 adults attending a 50th high school reunion and everyone loved this home!! The house was very welcoming and had wonderful amenities such as a back porch, multiple social gathering rooms on the first floor, a side patio with a fire pit and wood to burn, a beautiful landscaped yard and a big circular driveway. The full kitchen was well stocked. There was bottled water in all six bedrooms along with a large tray of individual snack food and basic toiletries in the bathrooms. Our group could not stop saying amazing things about this lovely well furnished and appointed home!! All of us would be happy return and stay there again. The host Leeland and the co-host Linda were very attentive and answered any questions someone may have had. I have stayed at many Airbnb homes and this one is exceptional!

review_text:
Our family came into town for two events, and needed a large home since there were 12 of us, and this beautiful home was perfect.
On arrival you will be impressed with the street view and landscaping, both were beautiful! The curved driveway could easily fit several cars, and the home is located on a very quiet street.
Simply put, the home is huge and was very clean, it provided us with lots of space to spread out and relax, both inside and out. There was an assortment of chocolates and snacks throughout the house and a very large welcome tray in each of the bedrooms, we felt pampered from the moment we opened the door.
The kitchen was stocked with every plate, glass, knife and appliance you could image. The prep station next to it was home to coffee and tea center, housing a variety of coffees and teas.

Our family truly enjoyed our stay, but what made it that more special to us, was the kindness and hospitality of the host and team, they truly were amazing! Thank you, again!

review_text: Our stay at 214 Oakdale was an enjoyable experience with my extended family and friends. The pictures used to describe the property accurately reflected the location. Even-though the home was large with a number of rooms, it felt cozy that allowed for privacy if one desired that. We enjoyed the many windows that provide good lighting during the day. The house was generally clean, yet some of the windows were dirty. The back porch was a favorite meeting spot for AM coffee or evening congregations. The kitchen was well supplied with dishes/utensils, plus a Keurig coffee maker was a bonus. We did have some challenges to find a comfortable setting for the A/C to balance between both floors. The humidity in the house was high that explains the number of humidifiers in the house. We could not get any of the TVâ€™s to show or play programming since it required us to subscribe to a Roku account that we were uncomfortable doing. This was disappointing since the TVs in the bedrooms would have been nice to use. Overall we rated the stay a 4 of 5 and would likely stay again with minor adjustments.

Stayed with a pet
review_text: We really enjoyed our stay at the Oasis guesthouse. It is decorated nicely and the furniture is comfy. The views from the back deck are gorgeous and there is a table and chairs on the deck making it great for enjoying a beverage. Although there is no true kitchen, there is a working microwave, coffee bar with Keurig, small fridge, kitchen sink with countertops, and a few dishes. My only complaint is that the only available plates aren't microwavable so we couldn't reheat leftovers. We chose to have the pool heated since we enjoy warm dips in cold weather. It was perfect for us even though its not hot tub temperature. Getting toasty in the water and then stepping out into the cold air felt sooooo good!For future travelers I will say that there are two levels to this guesthouse, and all sleeping quarters downstairs. Also, the gate that has to be opened to enter the exterior guest area is pretty heavy, so anyone with mobility issues should be aware of these two things about the property.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: Frankâ€™s place was lovely- a beautiful space to relax and decompress. Unfortunately, in order to know what youâ€™re getting, you have to look at the fine lines. Amenities that are listed include a hot tub, kitchen, dryer, washer, hot water kettleâ€¦. All of these were either completely missing (washer and dryer) or checked but not as advertised. Frank has a beautiful heated pool with a splash pad- what is advertised on the listing as a hot tub. When getting the welcome manual, it clarifies that the splash pad â€œdoublesâ€ as a hot tub- when it is neither deep enough (maybe 10 inches in depth) nor hot enough to fit the definition. The kitchen consists of a microwave, toaster, and small fridge. Pots and pans are advertised- but no cooking appliance is present to be able to cook anything, aside from an outdoor grill, of which these pans would be useless. This would have been a 5-star review, if it were not for the feeling that we had been misled by the list of amenities that were advertised.

review_text:
5 STARS!!! We truly had a magical stay at the Oasis of Martinsville! The pool was absolutely divine, with a waterfall, massage jets, and a splash pad. It was also very clean and, while in the back yard of the hosts' house, still felt very private. There are large trees throughout, which provided some shade, which was great for the dogs. Yet, the pool got lots of sunlightâ€”we both came back with suntans!
The guest house was spotless and well-appointed. The decor was lovely, and the bed linens were high-quality. While the kitchen is more like a kitchenette, it worked totally well for us. The fridge (and freezer) is bigger than it looks, and we brought our own air fryer for baking.
It was so relaxing just being able to float around the gorgeous pool while our dogs frolicked in the fenced back yard. The hosts were friendly, communicative, and left clear instructions for us. We would 100% return and recommend the Oasis to others!

review_text: â€œWowâ€ is the main word that comes to mind when writing this. From the get go, Frank and Alesia were fantastic with communication; they were willing to answer any questions we had, and their responses came almost immediately. They provided a very in-depth guide that was useful and appreciated. They were such terrific hosts! The Oasis was truly that- an oasis. While the pictures were accurate, they didnâ€™t do the Airbnb justice. The guest house was just the right size and had everything we needed, including plenty of pool towels. It was quite cozy yet had all the modern conveniences; we loved the huge amount of tv apps to choose from. The beds were incredibly comfortable, and we all slept like babies. The views out back were gorgeous, and the location was easy to find and was very quiet and peaceful, even though it is within quick access to restaurants, stores, etc. We appreciated the lighting and security; we felt safe inside and outside of the guest house while on the property. We were also grateful for the large numbers/locations of outlets to charge devices. The pool was our favorite feature and where we spent the most time. We loved that it can be heated, and it is very pleasing aesthetically. Thank you for such a wonderful time! We look forward to visiting again!

This is mentioned and we did fine but a consideration. Everything was sparkling clean! The kitchenette worked fine for us as I brought microwavable foods and we cooked burgers on the grill, had sandwiches and such. The owners guide includes suggested local restaurants as well but we didn't have a need to leave with everything provided. There are too many amenities to name! If you forget shampoo, soap, toothpaste, etc... It was there. The owners made sure the temperature for the home and the pool was adjusted to our comfort upon arrival. The fenced in private yard truly felt like our own oasis! I thought it would feel weird being in someone's back yard but it did not as the owners made sure you felt like you were in a private space. They were also very responsive when we messaged with a question. In all my only regret was the traffic and time that made us arrive late. We truly wished we had more time there to enjoy our stay.

Communication with Frank was super easy and he answered every question in a timely fashion and helped out with everything we needed. Frank even went out early in the morning to make sure the pool was being heated so when we were ready to swim it was ready and warm for us, I was unsure about turning on the gas fireplace so Frank took care of that as well for us. They go above and beyond to make sure you have everything you need while staying here! Frank and Alesia are spectacular host and have done an incredible job with their Oasis! While your staying there it feels like itâ€™s your own private spot to relax and hang out with family and friends. My chocolate lab Jeter also loved it! He enjoyed running around outside and even taking a dip in the pool as well! For me the fact they welcome pets here makes it even more perfect. If 10 stars were possible on Airbnb Frank and Alesia and the Oasis would earn every single oneâ€¦ this place is awesome as are the host! We canâ€™t wait to go back again and spend more time here! My wife and I found Joe and Maggie's place while we were looking for a place to stay near Martinsville/Bassett, Virginia sowe could do some trout fishing on the Smith River. Their rental does not disappoint! Much better than staying at a hotel that costs 2-3 times as much.
Just as advertised... lovely 2BR/1B that is new and fresh all around. Very well stocked with everything you need for a short or a lengthy stay. The location is in a nice residential neighborhood, but the neighbors are not right on top of one another. It's quiet, but in close proximityto anything you need... food, shops, speedway, fishing, hunting... very convenient location.
The hosts, Joe and Maggie, were top shelf! Great communication and very accommodating.
All in all... 5 Stars+++. Will definitely stay here again!

Cozy and inviting. Very easy to find location with off the street parking. The shower features were great. The open concept is nice. The color scheme and decor was just like the pictures.
The rooms only have two prongs, it maybe a little challenging for some electric devices that have 3 prongs but I was able to connect the devise in the kitchen with no issues. There is no iron but the host has a steamer that worked just as well. The TV has an option for you to sign into your Netflix, Hulu and Prime. YouTube was available.
The host was great responding and gave us suggestions for local restaurants; Yamato was a win. The stay was a good value for the price. We could definitely stay here again when we come back.

,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
The place was tidy and cozy, and the bed was comfortable. However, there were a lot of small things that were missing or off.
The bathroom: no floor mat when you get out of the shower. There is also no curtain on the bathroom window which made my wife a little concerned.
The Kitchen: There was no ice in the freezer part of the refrigerator â€“ only a filthy, empty ice tray. Also, the instructions asked that you wash your dishes but they do not offer a sponge or tool to do so. You are also asked to sign the Guest Book â€“ but there was none.
Coffee â€“ They offer K-cups but do not have sugar or any type of creamer option.
We were in the area for a funeral. That meant that I brought hanging garments. There is no place to hang clothes except on the towel holders in the bathroom.
Air conditioner was difficult to operate. Batteries may have been dying.

The decor was on point and the space was very comfortable.
Thanks to Morgan and Josh...
